answers.answer: If you try pumping I doubt anything will come out,  especially if you've never breastfed.  You may get a few drops. . But the isn't quite worth storing so you might as well wait for baby to come.  But if you do try and are successful,  you'd need to store it in a milk storage bag and put it in the freezer.And congrats,  hope you have an easy labor.
I have Gestational diabetes and the midwife told me if i can and if i have time to express some milk and put it into test tubes and freeze it.
I'm to scared to try my pump.. I'm overdue

The colostrum is really what's best for the baby right after they are born and will come before your milk does. If this is your first baby your milk could take a little to come in so don't pump wait till the baby is here and just latch them right on to you

question: So I'm aware pumping before having baby can put u into labor but I am 39 weeks so I'm not worried about that. But my question is can I pump and freeze my colostrum and if so how do u store it?
title: storing colostrum
